intro: Pasania omalokos, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and typically grows as an upright shrub. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are woody and branched. Pasania omalokos is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
